activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Warren D. Ament

records.addlTxt:
1:59 PM Defendant Warren D. Ament appeared by video. Attorney Gerald J. Hersil appeared by video for Warren D. Ament. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appearing by video. Calling 22CF121, 22TR1040 & 22TR1041. Hersil states has offer. Schiek states would like to set for pretrial. Bond continued. adj. 02:01 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
3:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski appeared by video. Defendant Warren D. Ament appeared by video. Attorney Gerald J. Hersil appeared by video for Warren D. Ament. Victim appearing by video. Calling 22CF121, 22TR1040 & 22TR1041. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Hersil willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Court states motion to modify bond was filed. Hersil states motion does not need to be heard at this time. Court will allow video appearance at next hearing if there is a waiver. Bond continued. adj. 03:35 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: May not operate a motor vehicle under any circumstances / no knowing contact with M.A.S.

1:19 p.m.Calling 22TR1040, 22TR1041, 22CF121. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Warren D. Ament appeared by video in custody. Also appearing by Zoom is MS -victim. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail - requesting $1000.00 cash bond. Address confirmed.  Court questions defendant.  Statements to employment / incident / doctors appointments, testing.  Victim statements.  Defendant's father in court - makes statements. Court statements to bond / sets bond. adj. 1:31 p.m.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
